thread.title: Wolf Pack alum Cody Fajardo signs with CFL team
thread.title_full: Wolf Pack alum Cody Fajardo signs with CFL team

title: Wolf Pack alum Cody Fajardo signs with CFL team
text:
Wolf Pack alum Cody Fajardo signs with CFL team Chris Murray , cmurray@rgj.com 7:15 p.m. PDT October 14, 2015 Former Nevada quarterback Cody Fajardo has signed with a CFL team. (Photo: RGJ file) 56 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Former Wolf Pack quarterback Cody Fajardo has signed onto the practice squad of the Toronto Argonauts of the Canadian Football League. 
The signing, which happened last week, gives Fajardo a chance to restart his pro career. Fajardo was undrafted but spent training camp with the Oakland Raiders. He was a training camp cut and has had tryouts with the Jaguars and the Giants in recent weeks before signing with the CFL team. 
Fajardo started for four seasons at Nevada and led the Wolf Pack to three bowl games. He became the second player in NCAA history to throw for at least 9,000 yards and rush for at least 3,000 yards in a career. The other was his predecessor, Colin Kaepernick. 
Toronto is 9-5 this season and their quarterback is Trevor Harris, who has completed 72.1 percent of his passes for 3,782 yards, 31 touchdowns and 14 interceptions. Toronto has four games remaining in the regular season. Read or Share this story: http://on.rgj.com/1RJ6Kfh TOP VIDEOS
